restaurant.name: Source Café
restaurant.description: Good for: chips and dip, all - families with kids incl, casual dining, A coffee and snack, cappuccino and coffee Not good for: parking a car.

restaurant.name: Fang Fang
restaurant.description: Good for: Sweet n sour pork, special occasions Not good for: budget dining

restaurant.name: Black Lantern
restaurant.description: Good for: overeating, Everyone! Not good for: your waistline

restaurant.name: Le Petit Bistro
restaurant.description: Good for: Home Cooking Not good for: french "foodies"

restaurant.name: Café Pap
restaurant.description: Good for: centrally located café, good coffee, Avocado-lemon smoothies Not good for: service is sometimes snippy, consistently available dessert

restaurant.name: Ling Ling
restaurant.description: Formerly Fang Fang.The best Chinese beyond Kampala, tuck into a good spread with drinks for around USh15,000.

restaurant.name: Masala Chaat House
restaurant.description: Good for: vegetarians, Delicious Indian Food Not good for: People too sensitive to spice

restaurant.name: Blue Mango
restaurant.description: For a good selection of grub from all over the globe, head to the suburban sanctuary that is the Blue Mango. The menu includes cheaper bar meals, such as pies with mash and crisp salads, and a more sophisticated range of meat, poultry and fish with a regional accent.

restaurant.name: Fasika
restaurant.description: Good for: Cheap good Ethiopian food Not good for: parking

restaurant.name: Canaan
restaurant.description: Local businessmen and officials fill the tables, and drinking is just as popular as dining. The menu is limited, but if you need a quick steak or a roast chicken, it can deliver

restaurant.name: Mamba Point
restaurant.description: For the best in Italian dining, make for Mamba Point, where the pasta is home-made and the menu as close to the homeland as you might hope to find in Africa. Save space for the exquisite desserts, which include lime syllabub and chocolate truffle torte.
